title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 21.32 - Classification of shrinkage
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 21.32 - Classification of shrinkage

State Regulations

Shrinkage shall be classified at each pool plant as
follows: (a) Compute the total
shrinkage of skim milk and butterfat, respectively. (b) Such shrinkage shall be assigned pro rata
to each class of use in accordance with the respective volumes of skim milk and
butterfat actually accounted for in each class, except that the shrinkage
assigned to each class shall not exceed two percent of the skim milk and
butterfat, respectively, in such class and any excess thereof shall be assigned
to the highest class available at the plant. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
21.32

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
